page.title: 01Ridgewood,Isfield & Horsted.
page.content: The area contains two major commun- ities;{Isfield}village which is a linear development and{Ridgewood}which is effectively a suburb of Uckfield. Many people live in individual houses or small clusters scattered throughout the countryside. The parish of{Little {Horsted}has no nucleated settlement but has quite a large population of 199 (1981 Census Returns). The local{relief}consists of undu- lating sandstone ridges. The Church at Little Horsted and the settlement at Ridgewood stand on the summits of two of these ridges. The settlements com- mand{attractive views}of the surround- ing landscape which is characterised by a patchwork of hedges,woodland and fields. In the distance there is the splendid panorama of the{South Downs extending from Wilmington in the East to Chanctonbury Ring in the West.
